programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns make a risky attempt to move their shelters closer to the barn as the first snow falls. Meanwhile, Noah prepares his pregnant wife Rhain for her first winter

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Between 1948 and 1960, governments around the world invested in electric tracks and diesel, but in Britain hundreds of steam-powered trains were built. This film looks at the reasons behind their continued production, and asks what happened to them

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Crewe to Crewe with Victoria Wood
programme.desc: Victoria Wood makes a round trip of northern England and Scotland starting at Crewe. She visits Carnforth Station, where David Lean shot the memorable location scenes in Brief Encounter, takes a sleeper train from Glasgow to Fort William and stops off at a railway museum in an enthusiasts back garden

programme.title: London to Brighton: Side By Side
programme.desc: In 1953, the BBC commissioned a recording filmed from the point-of-view of a London to Brighton train. In 1983, another film of the same journey was recorded. This short programme presents these two iconic recordings side-by-side, demonstrating how both locomotive technology and the landscape have evolved over the years

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland

programme.title: Phil Davis Remembers - The Firm
programme.desc: Phil Davis pays tribute to maverick film director Alan Clarke as he looks back on his time filming the 1989 drama, The Firm. He recalls how he was cast in the role of Yeti and how excited he was to work on this film about football hooliganism. Phil gets under the skin of the characters, explaining why they were attracted to mindless violence and how the cast all relished the opportunity to play these divisive roles and work with Clarke

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: Drama, starring Gary Oldman. An estate agent, with an apparently respectable family life, spends his weekends as the leader of a vicious firm of football hooligans who are planning a national assault on Europe. Co-starring Lesley Manville, Phil Davis and Charles Lawson. First broadcast 26 February 1989

programme.title: Why the Industrial Revolution Happened Here
programme.desc: Jeremy Black examines one of the most extraordinary periods in English history, explaining the unique economic, social and political conditions that led to the nation becoming the richest and most powerful on Earth by the 19th century. He traces the unprecedented explosion of new ideas and technological inventions that transformed an agrarian society into an increasingly industrial and urbanised one

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Between 1948 and 1960, governments around the world invested in electric tracks and diesel, but in Britain hundreds of steam-powered trains were built. This film looks at the reasons behind their continued production, and asks what happened to them

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland

programme.title: Britains Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri visit Brighton Museum to investigate who painted two neglected pictures of religious subjects. Plus, Emma investigates how Brightons Royal Pavilion ended up an empty shell, ransacked and sold to the local council

programme.title: Steam Days
programme.desc: Miles Kington travels along one of the most picturesque railways in Britain, from Fort William to Mallaig on the west coast of Scotland, a route used by crofters for the herring trade. First transmitted in 1986

programme.title: The Train Now Departing
programme.desc: Examining the events surrounding the proposed closure of the Settle to Carlisle line - over 72 miles long and Englands highest mainline, it was known as The Long Drag by the men who worked it. The programme follows the activists, comprised of railway-men, rail enthusiasts and local residents, who are rallying together to save the line. First broadcast 15 November 1988

programme.title: Brief Encounter
programme.desc: A suburban housewife meets a married doctor by chance in a railway station waiting room. Later, their paths cross many times until the pair become friends and their meetings a fixed arrangement. But as their feelings for each other transform from friendship into passion, both come to realise the affair is doomed to fail. David Leans romantic drama, starring Celia Johnson and Trevor Howard

programme.title: Sarah Churchwell Remembers - The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: Leading academic Sarah Churchwell looks at the origins of F Scott Fitzgeralds The Great Gatsby, and the inspiration behind its plot and characters. She also explores how the novel became an enduring work of art, which has been adapted and performed countless times since it was first published in 1925

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: A poor soldier leaves the love of his life to make his fortune overseas, but on his return is devastated to learn she has married a cruel, uncaring man. Throwing caution to the wind, he uses his newly acquired wealth and position in society to romance her - leading to tragedy for all concerned. Drama based on F Scott Fitzgeralds classic novel, starring Mira Sorvino, Toby Stephens, Paul Rudd and Martin Donovan

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: A profile of American writer F Scott Fitzgerald from the 75th anniversary of the publication of his most enduring achievement, The Great Gatsby, originally published in 1925. Also, exploring the novels importance within the 20th-century. First broadcast 3 April 2000

programme.title: Tár
programme.desc: Lydia Tár, principal conductor of the Berlin Philharmonic, is poised to begin rehearsals of Mahlers Symphony No 5 with the players. When disturbing accusations surface about the maestro and a troubled graduate of her academy, every aspect of Társ life comes under intense scrutiny. Writer-director Todd Fields drama, starring Cate Blanchett, Noemie Merlant and Nina Hoss

programme.title: Steam Days
programme.desc: Miles Kington travels along one of the most picturesque railways in Britain, from Fort William to Mallaig on the west coast of Scotland, a route used by crofters for the herring trade. First transmitted in 1986

programme.title: The Train Now Departing
programme.desc: Examining the events surrounding the proposed closure of the Settle to Carlisle line - over 72 miles long and Englands highest mainline, it was known as The Long Drag by the men who worked it. The programme follows the activists, comprised of railway-men, rail enthusiasts and local residents, who are rallying together to save the line. First broadcast 15 November 1988

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A fingerprint on a fish and chips wrapper places a gunman in a rural location and police on a stakeout witness the shooting of their target. Plus, a fraudster uses victims credit details to buy gift cards at luxury shops until police track him down and find a plethora of evidence on his laptop

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An update on a new build in Staffordshire as it reaches it conclusion, plus visits to properties in south east London and Greater Manchester. Presented Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Ardingly, West Sussex, and learns about the ancient craft of batik. Experts Kate Bliss and Gary Pe help the teams to find a bargain

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents further coverage of day five of the biennial event at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo, featuring the mens 1500m final at 2.20. Great Britains Josh Kerr claimed a stunning victory in this race two years ago, beating favourite Jakob Ingebrigtsen of Norway into second place, and Ingebrigtsen was eliminated in the heats this time around. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps an aspiring writer who wants to make a dramatic relocation from the frenetic bustle of east London to the rural idylls of Dumfries and Galloway in Scotland. With a budget of £300,000, he has his sights set on somewhere isolated that will inspire his creativity. Away from the houses, Alistair heads for the hills hoping to strike it lucky on a Scottish gold rush

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and JJ Chalmers are on the outskirts of Glasgow to visit Fred, who desperately needs their help after a recent diagnosis threw his life into uncertainty. Sorting through his items, they find valuable jewellery, scientific equipment and chairs, as well as more unusual equipment, including an unused 1950s toaster and some ice skates

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Stephen Mangan co-host the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Vernon Kay present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey and Zoe stake out Gregs place. Vicki is furious to learn Joel has played truant from school to attend the podcast recording event, and she turns to Julie for help with his behaviour. Lauren feels guilty when Louies present doesnt arrive in time for his birthday. Cindy suggests Peter should move in to help with the children

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals begin with a trip to Chawton House in Hampshire, once owned by Jane Austens brother, and the setting today for a special lunch to celebrate the literary giants birth 250 years ago. Working in two teams, the contestants must cook up a lunchtime feast that suits the occasion and is worthy of an 80-strong guest list that includes house staff, members of the Jane Austen Society and the writers fifth great-niece

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The film show may be over but the raw emotions seem likely to continue long after. The couples split into two groups and head off for days out on separate islands - unaware that castaways, some of whom are all too familiar, plan to gatecrash their parties. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Girl Fight
programme.desc: Rachel McIlhagga prepares for a kickboxing bout in Dublin, hoping she can rebuild her self-belief after a brutal MMA loss. Chloe Crozier is training for the biggest bout of her career - her first title fight. Winning a title is an essential step towards a professional fighting career, so Chloe must win to keep her dream of turning professional alive. Mother-and-daughter fighters Niamh McNeill and Julie train together, chasing their dream of appearing on the same card before Niamh leaves for a new life in Australia

programme.title: MOTD: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the matchday one league phase fixtures, including Liverpool v Atletico Madrid at Anfield, Athletic Bilbao v Arsenal at San Mames and Tottenham Hotspur v Villarreal at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. Liverpool topped this stage last season, but were eliminated by eventual champions Paris Saint-Germain in the last 16. Arsenal reached the semi-finals before also falling to PSG and their north London neighbours Spurs qualified for this competition after winning last terms UEFA Europa League

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes host a celebrity special of the music-based quiz show. Matt Edmondson, Jeremiah Asiamah, Keith Brymer Jones, Sophie Duker, and Shane and Sheena Lynch must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs for the charity of their choice

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kimberley Walsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a few tiny specks of grey paint help to solve not one, but two, brutal axe murders. Plus, how a bungling burglar was caught when his DNA is discovered on a rock used to smash a window. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts wants to run for the hills due to a tricky legal issue in Devon. Jacqui Joseph is in Eastbourne, East Sussex, where work is already under way at an end-of-terrace. Meanwhile, Dion Dublin heads to Northampton, where a smelly cellar is hard to cope with

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Siblings Anna and Will compete against amateur pilots Ben and Chris Roo Irvine, hunting for bargains at an antiques fair in in Co Antrim alongside expert advisors Caroline Hawley and Thomas Forrester. Host Roo Irvine dives into maritime history with a mightily heavy mystery item, made of solid brass with copper rivets

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents further coverage of day six of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo, featuring the mens and womens 400m finals at 2.10 and 2.24 respectively. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in Derbyshire with a recently married couple who are making an epic location shift and swapping the Blue Mountains in Australia for the wilds of the Peak District. They have a significant budget of £750,000 and have their hearts set on a character home with a large garden for their three dogs. Away from his quest, Jules comes across an unlikely centre of manufacturing nestled in the countys rural countryside

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Robin Johnson and James Broad help an Edinburgh widow sell her collectibles, turning up a rare watch that could make a small fortune at auction, a collection of railwayana, a 19th-century spinning wheel and a scratched magnifying glass

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest, presented by Roman Kemp and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack is set on revealing the truth about Zoes shooting, so Denise turns to Ravi for help. Julie attempts to talk to Joel about his misogynistic beliefs - but it may not be enough

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthals three Michelin-starred establishment The Fat Duck has inspired generations by ripping up the culinary rulebook. His dishes excite all senses, giving the diner an experience like no other. The semi-finalists mark the restaurants 30th anniversary by recreating some of his most celebrated dishes. They are next tasked to cook a dish filled with theatre and magic - something ambitious that is full of wonder. Emotion and storytelling are crucial components, as Heston will be hoping for some passion in the plates he tastes. Only five cooks will go through to the next round

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The events of castaway day cause a tidal wave across Honeymoon Island. A crate washes up to give the honeymooners some much-needed support from home, before one husband is left with a shocking decision to make. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers reviews the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in London to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from day five of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Great Britains Josh Kerr was looking to retain the 1500m title he won two years ago in Budapest, and his compatriot Molly Caudery was hoping to be in contention in the womens pole vault

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Queen Victorias coronation fails to go according to plan, George IV takes part in Historical Come Dine with Me, and Alexander the Great refuses to stop conquering things

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Manchester and discovers one of the most dilapidated clubs he has ever seen, with a clubhouse that is almost derelict and not enough players for even one team. He sets himself a deadline to get it back up and running by the end of the summer. In Blackpool, the girls team suffers a crisis of confidence when Freddie introduces the hard ball to training, then to make matters worse, theres a divide in the team

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: The Less I Know About Joe, the Better
programme.desc: A glimpse into the daily lives of Stacey Solomon, Joe Swash and their five children. Stacey and Joe trade school runs for ski runs in a snowy family adventure, but Joes big romantic surprise quickly melts into laughter when it goes wrong

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Molly seems to be settling into life in Afghanistan with surprising ease, as she even strikes up a rapport with a little girl named Bashira. However, not everyone is convinced their bond is a good thing, as Captain James advises the medic against becoming too involved with the locals. His words cause Molly to question Bashiras motives for befriending her, but when the youngster lets slip some vital information about the insurgency, the entire platoon has no choice but to embark on a potentially explosive mission. It looks as if Captain Jamess warning could come back to haunt Molly as she realises shes placed her own life and that of Bashira in danger. Lacey Turner, Ben Aldridge and Iwan Rheon star

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Molly and Smurf return to the UK for rest leave, but with their comrades facing a big threat in Afghanistan, they find it hard to switch off and settle into life back home. As Molly finds Smurf is the only one who understands how she feels, their friendship eventually deepens into something more serious - but then he makes a declaration that could ruin everything. Before long, they are back in the field, where Molly comes under threat from an old enemy. Military drama, starring Lacey Turner and Iwan Rheon

programme.title: Words on Bathroom Walls
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate, who inspires him to not be defined by his condition. Romantic drama, starring Charlie Plummer, Andy Garcia and Taylor Russell

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers the dark side of Thailands backpacker culture. In the first episode, she lands in trouble with the Thai police when she starts to uncover the scale of Thailands illegal sex industry. A visit to the Bangkok Immigration Detention Centre exposes how easy it is to get caught on the wrong side of the law

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets men chasing cheap thrills in Asias sex capital, Pattaya, and also talks to a local sex worker, who reveals the harsh reality of working in the illegal sex industry. She then heads to Ko Phangan, an exotic island famed for its spirituality and beauty. For Zara, this is paradise - but Lucio, a Brit who built a burgeoning cannabis business here while the drug was decriminalised, reveals that navigating the local law isnt always easy

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott experiences Ko Phangans famous Full Moon Party, but beneath the cheap cocktails, music and fire shows, theres danger lurking as the medical team treat a possible drink-spiking victim. She then travels to Phuket and experiences a taste of Thailands luxury lifestyle. But she also learns how dream holidays can quickly go wrong, hearing the case of a British holiday-maker who died on the island - and whose family is still searching for answers

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from day six of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Team GB stars Matthew Hudson-Smith and Amber Anning were both hoping for a podium place in the respective mens and womens 400m finals

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Roman Emperor Caesar Augustus reveals the lazy secret of his success, TVs most excitable reporter Bob Hale explains the very complex history of the Second World War, and Welsh hero Owain Glyndwr takes on the English in battle

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: As the unit prepares to withdraw from Afghanistan, the captain and Smurf both declare their feelings for Molly, creating a love triangle that compromises Army regulations. However, reality bites after another raid against the Taliban and soon the platoon is sent on one final, terrifying mission. Military drama, starring Lacey Turner, Ben Aldridge and Iwan Rheon

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Molly returns from Afghanistan, and with difficult questions raining down upon her, its clear that the things shes seen and heard there have had a life-changing impact. The devastating attack on Captain James and Smurf has left this soldier picking up the threads of her life and weaving them into some kind of future - but what will that entail? Ben Aldridge and Iwan Rheon also star in the military drama

programme.title: We Built a Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary following 19-year-old TikTok star Kyle Thomas as he attempts to build a zoo for exotic species and separate himself from past controversy with animal rights activists. He enlists the help of farmer and builder Phil Hughes and together the pair plan on turning Phils modest petting farm into a world-class sanctuary for unwanted exotic animals

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.sub-title: I Cannae Cos the Child Locks On
programme.desc: Sammyjo enlists the Longlox girls help as she makes plans for her and Garys first anniversary, while Carmen wants to pierce below the waist. After Nathans third weigh-in, the Bilton Boys head off for a nights camping

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.sub-title: I Looked Like Phil Mitchell Til I Was About Three
programme.desc: Shane starts preparing for life as an uncle as Jades baby bump grows and Carmen gets disappointing news about her piercing plans. The Bilton Boys save the day for Robbies mum and Sammyjos plans for a new tattoo take a surprising turn

programme.title: The Fast and the Farmer-ish
programme.desc: Teams compete to be the best tractor drivers in England. In this heat, the Leicestershire Diva Drivers are determined to outmanoeuvre Somersets Checkshirt Choppers and win a place in the semi-final. Farmer and YouTuber Tom Pemberton hosts as the teams go head-to-head in three high-octane agricultural challenges

programme.title: The Fast and the Farmer-ish
programme.desc: In the Welsh heat, two teams of young farmers from south-west Wales put their reputations as skilled drivers on the line. Its the West Wales Cowboys versus the Chipmunks, and both teams are determined to fly the flag for their nation in the semi-finals

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Good Vibrations/Puffs Perfect Picnic/Run, Mushpie, Run/Watch the Storm
programme.desc: Lilit is under pressure. Truff, the most talented musician in Mushton, has invited her, Mush-Mush and Chep to form a band with him. / Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / When Chep asks Mush-Mush and Lilit to go storm-watching and they refuse, Lilit feels bad and convinces Mush-Mush to join their friend.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Breathtaking Bolly Show/Work Like a Charm/Star Helpers/The Rollinator
programme.desc: If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was. / Chep becomes obsessed with learning all about Mushlore – all the funny little traditions and things that Mushables believe in. / Starmush’s back is stuck, and the Mushelder has no choice but to ask for help in Mushton. / Chep is so good at moss-marbles, no one wants to play him anymore! No one except Sumush who reveals himself to be a tough competitor.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Stuck In The Mud/Get The Egg Home/Fly, Chase, Fly/Oh My Compost
programme.desc: When Fung and Miff spoil Mush-Mush’s fun tunnel surprise he has been working on for ages, he wishes their day was ruined too. / When an egg blows down into the village, it is Mush-Mush and friends’ mission to return it to Mush Mountain. / Chep is disappointed Mush-Mush and Lilit are too busy leaf-gliding to play moss-ball with him, so he hangs out with a new weevil friend instead. / When Sushi-Mushi breaks the only spoon he has ever cooked with, he declares his cooking days are over!

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Save The Fun Tree/Stuck In The Mud/Get The Egg Home/Fly, Chase, Fly/Oh My Compost/Snails Forever
programme.desc: Mush-Mush and friends’ favourite play tree is rotten and doomed. programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: ...Bear/Shaken-Up Bear/Piñata Party/Bear Game/Ranger Lemming/Halloween Bear/Clean Bear/Wandering Spirits => Grizzys last jar of chocolate spread was pinched by the Lemmings who are savoring it in secret. / Wedged in his sofa to relieve his aching back Grizzy balks at getting up. / The vibrations created by Grizzys snoring during his nap give the Lemmings an idea for a bouncing game. / Grizzy finds a piñata in the rangers living room. The idea of breaking a papier-mâche statue with a bat like it says in the instructions pleases him. / Inside a mysterious cave Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a magical Game of the Goose. / Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove. / Grizzy discovers the leftovers of a Halloween party in the rangers cabin which was entirely redecorated for the occasion. / Grizzy wants to give the she-bear hes in love with a plastic ring which he finds really swell. / Grizzy finds a strange figurine with the power to switch the spirits of two living beings and finds himself imprisoned in the body of a caribou.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Missing Mushlet/The Hero Trap/Bird Call/Let It Bee/The Staff Of Wisdom
programme.desc: So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine. / The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out. / Chanterelle has built a whistle that can reproduce the most beautiful sound of the forest: the one of the Nightingale. / Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers – a job that takes time and care. / Mush-Mush is amazed by the way Mushpot uses his staff of wisdom and how awesome it makes him look.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

programme.desc: Chep is very excited: tonight, a rare and extremely stinky plant is going to bloom! programme.title: Moley
programme.desc: When Manny accidentally transports a heap of trash into Moletown, Moley attempts to recycle it by fixing up the town. / When a cell phone falls into Roley Poley park from the Great Above, the entire town is mesmerized by it and Moley must break the “spell” it has on them. / When Moley gets in over his head when he enters a spicy chile eating contest, Manny accidentally makes the chile come alive! / When Moley is given the key to the city, he has such a great day he convinces Manny to let him repeat the whole day! / Moley vows to not eat worms for a few days in support of Dotty’s veganism and his worm craving temptations get out of control.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: A Frog Of A Problem/Fool The Forest/Mushroomates/Race The Beast/Surprise, Its Spring/The Missing Mushlet
programme.desc: Mush-Mush’s favourite frog has had its home taken over by a lizard. Mushpot says not to interfere – nature will balance itself out. / It’s Fool the Forest Day! Mushables pull pranks all over Mushton, and Mush-Mush has an epic one planned. / When ants invade Fung and Miff’s tree, our Mushlers offer for them to move in… but the two quickly turn out to be unbearable roommates. / Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Mirror, Mirror On The Wall/Grizzy The...
programme.desc: ...Wizard/Moonwalk Bear/Camping in the Wild/Ice and Bears/Carried Away Bear/Fountain of Bear Youth/Lemmings Kit/Timeless Bear => While salmon fishing on the riverbank Grizzy hauls in an unusual catch: an old hand mirror straight out of a fairytale. / In a casing that fell from a circus caravan the Lemmings find a magic stick that can enchant objects and make them come alive. / Grizzy stops the Lemmings from playing with fireworks. / With their endless battles over the rangers cabin which they do not want to share Grizzy and the Lemmings end up blowing the cabin up. / The Lemmings encounter a white bear which has drifted all the way to them on a chunk of ice which is slowly melting. / Grizzy gets rid of the Lemmings by crushing them. / The Lemmings discover a strange pond in an American Indian grotto that has the power to rejuvenate anyone who dips in it. / Before taking a nap Grizzy locks the food in a cupboard to prevent the Lemmings from getting into it. / When Grizzy and the Lemmings accidentally activate a magic disk representing the earth they are sent back in time to the prehistoric era.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Snake Dance/Grasshopper Chep/The Adventurers/Getting Truffy With It/Good Vibrations
programme.desc: When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilit’s flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back. / All the Mushables have fun zooming down a long mudslide except Chep, who just cant get up the courage to do it. / Because Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit are always up to new adventures, Bolly has dubbed them The Adventurers. / Truff is happy. He has found a necklace that makes him even Truffier! Except he had no idea the necklace belongs to Starmush. / Lilit is under pressure. programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome Zuri, Otis, Theo, Reau, Elijah and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Giovanna has a tambourine inside her bag. All the parents and babies have different noisy objects and toys in their bags too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are encouraged to hide baby-appropriate noisy toys and objects inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, and then play with the items together! The fun childrens song Noisy Noisy Shaker features, as does a story about Baby Bear and Baby Tiger making lots of noise, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring sounds too. The Baby Bear Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory lights and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: The Donald Trump Show
programme.desc: A novel take on the US presidents second term in office, recutting archive news clips as drama to retell Trumps story. The second episode focuses on President Trump as he pursues an ambitious agenda to transform America. Hes learned his lessons from his first term and seems not to be allowing anyone or anything to get in his way, breaking with the democratic norms the country was founded on. As he takes on the media, the press and the universities while ensuring that he keeps US borders secure, Trumps sends the National Guard to Los Angeles and Washington DC

programme.title: Trump v The Truth
programme.desc: One of the characteristics of both of Donald Trumps presidential terms is his disconnection from truth. To coincide with his second state visit to the UK, over several hours, Channel 4 examines a series of President Trumps statements that are untrue. Drawn from interviews, social media, press conferences and speeches from the last eight months, each false claim will be followed by an analysis of the claim. The false claims might include misleading pronouncements, sweeping assertions without evidence, baseless claims, factual inaccuracies, and the sharing of fake or untrue social media posts

A husband-and-wife duo bought the business eight years ago in the hope of continuing the places success, but started losing money rapidly. With a Cuban chef cooking Nordic cuisine and a filthy kitchen, things go from bad to worse until it all comes to a head on relaunch night

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge bumps her head while cleaning the kitchen and loses any recollection of Homer - who is forced to woo her all over again in a bid to re-establish their relationship and restore domestic bliss to the Simpson household

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Homer and Marge Turn a Couple Play
programme.desc: Homer and Marge dispense marital advice to a player on the Isotopes baseball team whose career is flagging due to his sexy wife singing at each game. The Simpsons soon find their own marriage on the rocks, and struggle to save their relationship while helping the couple. With the voice of Mandy Moore

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Docent, A Little Lady and a Bouncer Named Dalton
programme.desc: The youngster gets a summer job at the local train museum. Missy embarks on a new stage of womanhood and Georgie discovers Marys guilty pleasure. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Training Wheels and an Unleashed Chicken
programme.desc: With college in sight, Sheldon is determined to ride his bike without training wheels. All goes well until he has a run in with a chicken and falls, breaking his arm. Mary and George Sr argue over parenting styles. Comedy, starring Imagine Armpit

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard is put in charge of looking after Stephen Hawkings wheelchair when the famous scientist comes to lecture at the university for a week - and takes advantage of his position to blackmail Sheldon into performing assorted unpleasant tasks. Guest starring Stephen Hawking

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Raj organise a stag party for Howard, but stories about his sexual history are unwittingly revealed, and he has to persuade bride-to-be Bernadette not to call off the wedding. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil finds himself in an awkward situation when he meets his former high-school girlfriend, who confesses she still has feelings for him, while Mitchell stands up to his boss and Jay summons up the courage to confess he killed Mannys turtle

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire help out with their childrens school projects, while Gloria and Cameron spend quality time together. Elsewhere, Mitchell and Manny learn they have more in common than they thought during a trip to watch a meteor shower with Jay. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tries to get Sheldon into the Christmas mood by playing a game, but things do not go as planned when Sheldon reveals a childhood trauma. Raj goes out with the girls and reveals he had crushes on both Penny and Bernadette - but not Amy. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is not pleased when his assistant Alex starts flirting with Leonard and has a word with her about it. Unfortunately, his comments are so inappropriate that he is accused of sexual harassment and sent to the universitys human resources department, where he ends up dragging Leonard, Raj and Howard into trouble too. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys become stranded in the middle of nowhere when Leonards car is stolen en route to the Bakersfield comic-book convention. Meanwhile, back at home, the women try to work out why the guys are so fascinated with such publications

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is furious when the university forces him to work with Kripke, while Howards hobby lands him in financial trouble. However, that doesnt stop him and Raj getting expensive action figures of themselves made - much to Bernadettes disapproval

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Holt find the motivation to help Captain CJ with a big case that is proving problematic. Jeffords imposes a green initiative and tells Gina to remove her precious portable heater from the office. Diaz and Boyle take a break from the night shift to visit a foot massage parlour

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Boyle enlists Peraltas help in tracking down his sons favourite toy for Christmas, but they find themselves accidentally facing off against a Latvian crime ring as a result. Back at the precinct, the team members get ready for the annual Christmas carol competition against their rivals at the Metropolitan Transit Authority. Mary Lynn Rajskub guest stars

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is distressed to learn that Lenny and Carl fixed the result of a senior class presidential election, which he lost in high school - leading him to speculate on how his life would have changed for the better had he won the ballot

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Principal Skinner takes the schools underachieving pupils on a trip to ensure they miss a standard test and unexpectedly finds himself rediscovering his enthusiasm for teaching. Paranoia stalks Homer after he forgets to pay the familys insurance bill and leaves him trying to prevent a host of imaginary catastrophes

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls night in making home-made jewellery. Guest starring Bob Newhart, with Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard becomes concerned that Sheldon will overreact when his friend learns the truth about a past indiscretion, while Penny confronts Rajs old flame Lucy about the way she ended their relationship. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is dismayed when the group spends the Thanksgiving holiday at Mrs Wolowitzs house, but hits it off with Bernadettes father. Meanwhile, Penny realises she must deal with a mistake from her past when she and Leonard have an argument. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is bothered by the attention he receives in the wake of his heavy element discovery, but is taken aback when his work is disproved by Leonard. Meanwhile, Raj makes Howard and Bernadette feel inadequate when he stays with them for a week and is the perfect house guest

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Bart transform a losing racehorse into a champion - much to the dismay of rival jockeys, who soon start threatening dire reprisals. With the voices of Randy Bachman and Fred Turner

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Maude Flanders is killed in a tragic accident at the racetrack, leaving Ned facing a lonely old age - so unlikely matchmaker Homer volunteers to help him get back on to the dating scene. With the guest voice of Shawn Colvin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa lets her imagination run wild when she makes a new friend and they create a magical kingdom together called Equalia, complete with characters and plotlines. But they find themselves facing a nightmare when the boundaries between reality and fantasy become blurred. With the voice of Emily Blunt

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In an attempt to improve his public image, Mr Burns takes to selling plant-based burgers, but Lisa is unable to believe that he has changed his ways.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A sexual health adviser with two soon-to-be-married daughters goes looking for love, and a part-time singer enjoys an evening with a professional magician. Other visitors to the restaurant include an accountant contemplating parenthood, a car enthusiast who has been single for seven years, and a call-centre worker who has yet to fall in love

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Late Late Show with James Corden and Prince Harry, Married at First Sight Australia, Drawers Off, Million Pound Pawn, Your Honor, Pooch Perfect, Stand Up and Deliver, and ITV news coverage of a speech by Donald Trump. From March 2021

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Oprah with Meghan and Harry and the subsequent news that Piers Morgan had resigned as co-host of Good Morning Britain. Other programmes being considered include Paranormal Lockdown UK, The Celebrity Circle for Stand Up to Cancer, Teen First Dates, Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby and BBC News coverage of NHS pay

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Barrister Sarah enters the restaurant looking for love and finds herself paired with ex-military man Dan. Mancunian friends Megan and Ellena are on a double date hoping that Liverpudlian Liam and Yorkshireman Dylan are the partners theyve been looking for. Self-described maximalist Aayziat meets astro-chemist Zac

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes two more people looking for love to take their pick from six nude candidates. Retired dentist Leanne is recently divorced and in search of a sexually experimental man, while former US marine Conor, who falls in love all too easily, is looking for his dream Englishwoman

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge breaks her leg in a skiing accident and has to recover in hospital - so Lisa volunteers to take over as head of the household until she is well again. Unfortunately, Bart and Homer prove so awkward and unhelpful that she is driven to desperate measures

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: The duo find themselves in a fight against face-hugging aliens who just happen to have an MandMs store

programme.title: Mike Tyson Mysteries
programme.desc: For once, and surely the only time, Mikes attorney needs Tysons help

programme.title: Mike Tyson Mysteries
programme.desc: An unspeakable tragedy haunts Pat, his brother Nat and their Clam Shack

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Late Late Show with James Corden and Prince Harry, Married at First Sight Australia, Drawers Off, Million Pound Pawn, Your Honor, Pooch Perfect, Stand Up and Deliver, and ITV news coverage of a speech by Donald Trump. From March 2021

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: The interior is rife with conflict as Barbie continues to test boundaries with Fraser. Cat struggles to keep up with the super-yacht standard and find her place in the crew. Jareds personal challenges take a toll on him, Sunny deals with the consequences of mixing work and play, while Captain Kerry takes on his most important role of the season

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: Oscar-winning Second World War biopic of the American general admired for his brilliant tactical skills and ability to inspire his men to great things. But this complex man was equally noted for his abrasive temper, egotism and consuming sense of rivalry, which so antagonised his superiors he was eventually relieved of his command. Starring George C Scott, Karl Malden, Michael Bates and Stephen Young

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: A Belgian priest living in exile in Britain during the Second World War becomes a secret agent for the Allies, but his first mission is a disaster, leading to the capture of a resistance leader. Four soldiers are sent into occupied France to rescue the insurgent, but begin to realise they have a traitor in their midst. Thriller, starring Jack Warner and Simone Signoret

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villains cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: A retired school teacher whose husband has recently died longs to experience the passion that was missing in her marriage. She resolves to get a crash course in pleasure by hiring a charming young sex worker. Comedy drama, starring Emma Thompson and Daryl McCormack

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: Film assistant Manuel Torres yearns to rise through the ranks in 1920s Hollywood, starting with a lowly position working for matinee idol Jack Conrad. Manny is smitten with ingenue Nellie LaRoy, who intends to achieve big screen fame. Their fates entwine with a motley crew of wannabes and hangers on. Writer/director Damien Chazelles comedy drama, starring Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie and Diego Calva

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: Dead of Night
programme.desc: A group of people gather at a country house where their supernatural stories become all too real for one of the guests, who realises theyre all part of his recurring nightmare. Horror anthology, starring Mervyn Johns, Michael Redgrave and Googie Withers

programme.title: Hue and Cry
programme.desc: A schoolboy in post-war London stumbles on a criminal conspiracy whose members use his favourite comic strip to secretly send information to each other about their illegal activities. The police do not take him seriously, so he enlists his friends to help stop the crooks. Ealing comedy, starring Alastair Sim, Harry Fowler, Jack Warner and Valerie White

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: An ambassadors son idolises his fathers butler, and tries to throw the police off his scent when he is suspected of murder. However, the boys actions only make the servant seem more suspicious, and he begins to realise that his hero may have deceived him. Crime drama, starring Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: A butler in a 1930s aristocratic household has dedicated himself to serving his master, putting duty above all else and repressing his affection for the housekeeper, who also happens to be in love with him. On the outbreak of war, the noblemans Nazi sympathies come to light, marking a change of heart in the old servant, who looks back with misgivings about the loyalty that may have cost him dearly. Period drama, with Anthony Hopkins, Emma Thompson and James Fox

programme.title: The Contractor
programme.desc: After being involuntarily discharged from the Marines, a man joins a paramilitary organisation to support his family in the only way he knows how. Drama, starring Chris Pine, Ben Foster, Gillian Jacobs and Kiefer Sutherland

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: A lawyer in Mississippi agrees to defend a black man charged with killing the two racist thugs who raped his 10-year-old daughter - but he is ill-prepared for the racial tension and violence that erupts during the course of the trial. Courtroom drama, based on a novel by John Grisham and starring Matthew McConaughey, Sandra Bullock, Samuel L Jackson, Donald Sutherland and Kevin Spacey

programme.title: Dreamland
programme.desc: During the Great Depression, Eugene Evans dreams of escaping his small Texas town when he discovers a wounded, fugitive bank robber. Torn between claiming the bounty for her capture and his growing attraction to the seductive criminal, Eugene must make a decision that will affect the lives of everyone hes ever loved. Romantic drama, starring Finn Cole and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is approached by the wife of a wanted man eager to turn himself in peacefully, provided Josh splits the bounty with his wife. To ensure the deal goes as planned, Josh enlists the aid of his old friend Sheriff Pat Garrett

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: A spy for the Confederacy during the American Civil War decides to make a fresh start after the conflict, and takes a job working for a railroad freight company. However, his past catches up with him in the form of a former ally who is now the leader of a gang of bandits and is plotting a train robbery. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Claire Trevor and Joan Weldon

Musical comedy Western, starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin, with music by Nat King Cole and Stubby Kaye

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paul begins to realise the extent of his feelings for Grayson, while Marlon fears the truth about the robbery will come out when he learns of Elis involvement with Debbie.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paul tries to stifle his feelings for Grayson. Diane struggles to put Billy behind her, and Marlon catches Eli smuggling stolen goods into the house.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Deirdre is furious when she discovers Ken spent the night at Denises, and wastes no time making her feelings known. Pauls hopes of avoiding Leanne are dashed when Carla invites her to dinner

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Denise attempts to put things straight between Ken and Deirdre - but all she achieves is a massive three-way argument in the Rovers. Fiz goes on a trip down memory lane with an old flame

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: PC Penhale is delighted by the arrival of his older brother Sam, but their reunion turns to misery when Martin delivers bad news to one of them. Louisa searches for a new home in the village and visits Edith for a check-up, where she reveals an embarrassing piece of information, and Al makes his situation with Pauline worse by trying to act on advice from Bert. Starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Al tries to raise some quick cash, and offers to sort out all Louisas household and plumbing problems if she can pay him promptly. The teacher gets good news on the employment front, and Martin accidentally inflicts a minor wound on an elderly patient - who responds by walking out of the surgery and vowing never to return. Drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with Phyllida Law and Benjamin Whitrow

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A routine visit turns into a nightmare for Jill when she is taken hostage by a psychologically damaged ex-prisoner of war, who has barricaded himself into his house and booby-trapped the surrounding land with mines. Meanwhile, Harper is spotted paying frequent visits to a woman in town and Alun is suspended from duty when his noisy band practice causes a woman to slip and break her hip. Medical drama, starring Robert Daws, Amy Robbins, Wendy Craig, Ian Carmichael, Michael Starke, John Axon and Andy Wear

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina helps an old flame who goes AWOL from the Army and David ends up with more than egg on his face when Greengrass arranges a gourmet dinner at the pub. Nostalgic drama, starring Tricia Penrose and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The residents of Aidensfield find themselves in the grip of a flu epidemic, putting baby Sam at risk. Meanwhile, Greengrass grudgingly finds himself helping the police retrieve an old friends stolen property, and Blaketons interference in the running of the pub drives Gina up the wall. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Donnas suspicions put Eli in the frame as the man who shot Marlon. Rosemary continues to try to unite Katie and Grayson, while Jos farm tours get off to a flying start.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon comes clean to Donna about his role in the robbery. Laurel gets amorous in a desperate bid to induce her baby, while Billy accuses Diane of trying to split him and Val up.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ken moves in with Denise and announces he wont be in touch with Deirdre unless she apologises. Michelle tells Steve a secret about Paul after hearing about their high-stakes round of golf

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve and Michelle are caught kissing - but Liz isnt too happy about the blossoming relationship - while Blanche plays match-maker when Ken comes to collect more things.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Pauline finds out about Martins imminent departure to London and confronts him over her uncertain future. Aunt Joan tries to solve her farms money problems by opening a BandB - and ends up having to call the doctor for her first guest, local farmer Ted. Elsewhere, Bert organises a baby shower for Louisa. David Ross (The Green Green Grass) guest stars, with Martin Clunes, Stephanie Cole and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor spends his last day in Portwenn seeing an influx of patients as he prepares to close down the surgery and move to London. As he bids farewell to old friends and sets off to leave the village, he sees Louisas teaching assistant Tasha fall from the Harbour Day stage and stops to help. But the bigger hold-up comes when pregnant Louisa is involved in a car accident. Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass meets his match in a gang of loutish Liverpudlians, and the Aidensfield bobbies investigate a case worthy of Agatha Christie, involving an old woman found dead in a mysterious house. Meanwhile, behind the scenes, Craddock makes a shock announcement to Ventress. Bill Maynard, William Simons and Philip Franks star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress tries to discover why an old foe has returned to Aidensfield, and Greengrass makes a touching promise to a dying friend - but has a fight on his hands keeping it. Meanwhile, Maggie is concerned about a girl who wants an abortion. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when the body of a wildlife ranger is found on a remote island off the coast of Northumberland. Her death is at first assumed to be an accident, since she was alone on the island when she died, but marks on the body seem to point to murder. As Vera delves into the dead womans personal life, she uncovers dark secrets and old resentments

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: While investigating the fatal stabbing of a psychiatrist with a caseload of violent adolescent patients, Ronnie and Joes first instinct is to question those he was treating. However, the case takes a disturbing turn when the detectives discover a hidden sleeping compartment in the victims office which has clearly been used recently by one of his underage visitors - and evidence comes to light suggesting he may have been having an affair with one of them. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, with Ramon Tikaram and Hattie Morahan

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: While working with the drug squad, Ronnie and Joe find a skeleton that has been hidden inside the boot of a car in the River Thames. It turns out to be the remains of Taylor Kane, an undercover policeman who went missing in the 1980s - around the time of the Brixton riots. Through clever detection, unsettling evidence is unearthed and the team knows it must raise issues the police would rather forget. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, and featuring one of the last performances by Roger Lloyd-Pack, who died in January

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: The hunt for the killer of a seemingly innocent family man brings Ronnie into contact with his old boss, former DI Natalie Chandler, whose father is accused of the crime. She wastes no time in persuading the detective to go above and beyond the call of duty to exonerate her dad and find the real culprit - even if that means getting him into trouble with an increasingly frustrated Wes. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, with Harriet Walter, Martin Jarvis and Roy Hudd

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete is questioned by police, but Miles leaks the story to the press, costing him his job. With his life unravelling, Pete realises he must dig into Miless murky past to save his family. Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.desc: Donna is stunned by Marlons revelation. She lashes out at Eli and tells him to get out of her life, before telling Marlon their marriage is over.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Emily inadvertently locks Laurel in the church, where she goes into labour with only Shadrach on hand to help. Diane argues with Jack before kissing Billy in the Woolpack.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz is mortified by Johns reaction to their kiss, only to get an even bigger surprise when Kirk catches up with her. Steve has his hopes of a romantic evening dashed.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Michelle looks forward to another date with Steve, only to discover hes brought Amy along. Kirk is distraught after being dumped, while Claire takes decisive action against the Mortons.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The curmudgeonly GP struggles to come to terms with his new role as a father, having planned to resume his career as a consultant in London before the arrival of his and Louisas as-yet unnamed son. To make matters worse, he begins to have serious doubts about the competency of his replacement Dr Di Dibbs when she misdiagnoses a patient as well as herself. Martin is then dealt a devastating personal blow after hearing his aunt Joan has died. Starring Martin Clunes, Joanna Scanlan and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The GP returns to his former post at the surgery after the departure of Dr Dibbs, agreeing to stay until a replacement is found. He persuades a reluctant Louisa to move into his house so he can help raise their son, and suggests they could all move to London together in the future. Martin then delivers the eulogy at his aunt Joans funeral and speaks to her sister Ruth, who proves to be just as cantankerous as he is. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with Eileen Atkins

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike attracts the unwanted attentions of a famous romantic novelist who has moved to the area in search of literary inspiration, while borstal boys on a work placement cause mayhem in the village. Greengrass helps a would-be councillors election campaign - and has no qualms about playing dirty to foil rival candidate Blaketons bid for office. Starring Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike plans to marry Jackie in secret, but the search for an armed train robber threatens to keep him from getting to the church on time. Meanwhile, Greengrass faces another kind of crisis _ his charismatic sister Isabelle turns up in Aidensfield, and proves to be more than a match for him. Judy Cornwell guest stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is drawn into Newcastles underworld to discover the identity of a murder victim found dead in the river, with no clue as to who he is apart from a distinctive drugs wrapper. She discovers the dead man had ties to some very dangerous people, many of whom may have wanted him dead, while a witnesss testimony links the case to a remote farm where a murder took place 13 years previously. The connection brings Kennys past back to haunt him, as he was responsible for seeing the perpetrator convicted

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: When the body of an elderly woman is discovered at a well-known suicide spot, Ronnie soon detects foul play, with suspicion falling on the victims son and daughter-in-law, as well as a doctor who has recently arrived in the UK. However, even after a confession is secured, Joe remains baffled as to the motive, and Kate struggles to remain professional - jeopardising her career and leaving Jake to prosecute the case alone. Guest starring Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: A blood-spattered hotel room and a stolen credit card lead Ronnie and Joe to Charles Hutton, a member of the wealthy upper classes who dotes on his wife Camille and daughter Georgia. The detectives find clues that suggest Georgia gave birth at the scene, but where is the baby now? The young woman and her boyfriend Rufus prove difficult for Jake and Kate to prosecute, and to make matters worse, the defence counsel turns out to be Jakes old nemesis. As the evidence stacks up, how far will Charles go to protect his privileged family? Guest starring James Wilby and Joseph Millson

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: English country squire Marcus Waverly receives a series of anonymous letters threatening to kidnap his son Johnnie, but the case is dismissed by Scotland Yard - prompting Poirot to open his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet and Geoffrey Bateman

programme.desc: The final court hearing looms and the fate of the boys is set to be decided. Will Miless twisted lies be exposed for what they are, or will Pete and Maddie lose everything? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Phillip gets creative upcycling 1950s style furniture, while at Château de la Fare, Janet and Phillip put all their energy into finishing their large Empire Suite

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Alston House in Cumbria, where owners Michael and Carole Allchorne are brimming with confidence, but Yvonne Copeland and Gail Wells are less than impressed with the decor. The guests are impressed with chef Michaels breakfast, but the hosts are left reeling by the criticisms levelled at their hotel during the feedback session

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Scotia House in Harrogate, where host Marie Lock is hoping her obsessive cleaning regime will give her the edge in the competition. In the rooms, both Michael and Carole and Yvonne and Gail find the deluxe teddy bears freaky, and for Billy and Billy, things are a little on the cosy side. In the afternoon, Maries keen to show off her moves and pits her guests against each other in a Northern Soul dance off

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Canberra Guest House in Blackpool for the third day of the competition, where host Yvonne Copeland, joined by her part-time helper Gail Wells, hopes her cheap and cheerful BandB will win over her guests. However, Marie finds what she thinks is urine and hair on the toilet seat in her room, and a lack of wi-fi means Billy Junior has to put his business on hold. Yvonne takes her competitors to a local reptile house, but serious divisions unfold within the group, and later, tensions rise again at dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Crown and Kitchen in East Linton, East Lothian, owned by father and son Billy and Billy Jr Robertson, who see themselves as the jokers of the pack. Yvonne and Gail leave no mattress unturned in their room inspection, although Michael and Carole are impressed. Later, Yvonne makes quite a splash when the hosts organise an assault course for their guests, but slow service during breakfast leaves the BandBers disappointed - especially when Billy Jr is at a loss to explain what the problem was

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Things are tense from the start as Carole and Michael from Alston House challenge Marie on her comments. Next, Marie from Scotia House wants to set the record straight with allegations of tit-for-tat scoring. The group members proceed to thrash out their differences before the weeks winners are revealed

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw restore a Citroën SM - widely considered one of the greatest French cars ever - after it suffered catastrophic engine failure on its first outing

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Norfolk to take on a 1962 TVR Grantura that has been off the road for nearly 50 years

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help Priti and Shakti find their first family home while staying close to the buzz of London. Cheesemonger Julia is looking for a slice of the countryside after having moved out of the city to look after her elderly father during lockdown

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with Steph and Mark who, in 2011, asked for their help to find a property they could live together and eventually have children in. Phil helped them find a project property with three bedrooms for nearly £40,000 under their budget. Today, they are still in the property which looks now looks very different. In 2020, Kirstie and Phil met Elliot and James who were looking to find a home they could share with four bedrooms and an open plan entertaining space in London. After a struggle with the budget, Kirstie found the pair a property, now Phil is back to find out what they have done with the space

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Mark and Candida Diacono, who have set about building a home in the shape of a plough on their 17-acre smallholding in Devon. With its complex curved roof, timber-clad exterior and steel-framed working barn, the ambitious project presents a unique technical challenge for a local builder and his team of employees, and the task proves even more intimidating when considering Mark and Candida hope to complete work on the build within seven months

programme.title: The Orient Express: A Golden Era of Travel
programme.desc: The Express travels east through Austria. At a stopover in Vienna theres a session at the home of Sigmund Freud, the father of psychoanalysis, whose own flight to freedom is forever linked to the Orient Express. Later on in Budapest, theres a visit to one of the worlds longest and fastest tram lines, run entirely by children

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: On a busy Saturday night at Kings College Hospital, staff have to juggle the needs of elderly patients and sick children alongside those who are drunk or violent. Paramedics bring 12-year-old Grace into resus after she falls down a flight of stairs, while Sarah and Andy are concerned for their 10-month-old son Dexter, who has a high temperature and is unresponsive. Elsewhere, clinical site manager Gordon has a series of tests as a result of senior sister Jen noticing his bloodshot eye

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: The staff of Kings College Hospital treat patients involved in traffic accidents. Jade from Kent is brought in after being hit by a car and knocked under a bus on her way to school, and doctors are concerned the 12-year-old may have fractured her skull. Meanwhile, Geraldine, 60, has been injured while trying to cross the road, and after recently being released from prison 40-year-old Brian is in minors with a broken ankle, but the swelling means his electronic curfew tag will have to be removed

programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty travels to Turkey to investigate oregano, Kate Quilton examines the worrying rise in peanut allergies and Matt Tebbutt traces the British blackcurrant from the field to the Ribena factory

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple with a new BandB argue over renovations, a family of brewers from Kent dash across the Channel to beat lockdown, and a restaurateur from Skegness finances hang by a thread
